title: Exposure Margin
text: example exposure margin calculated dog 4 week (IV) study using body surface area (BSA) formula. Clinical information: Human Proposed “Start Dose”: 1.5 mg/day Dog Human conversion factor = 1.8 HED = Human Equivalent Dose Dog 4 week (IV) study: Exposure Margin Calculation HED = Animal Dose / Conversion factor Dog Human conversion factor 1.8 = 0.25/1.8 = 0.139 mg/kg/day =0.8/1.8 =0.44 mg/kg/day =2.5/1.8 =1.39 mg/kg/day mg/kg/day —> mg/day Human weight 60 kg =0.139*60 =8.33 mg/day =0.44*60 =26.67 mg/day =1.39*60 =83.33 mg/day Proposed Human Start Dose =1.5 mg/day Exposure Margin = HED/Human dose =8.33/1.5 =5.6 26.67/1.5 =17.78 =83.33/1.5 =55.55 <<<

title: Introduction
text: Multiple studies done animals ensure safety Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient (API) prior initiation clinical trials. Pharmacologist toxicologist may want compare among studies. app generate plot shows doses calculated exposure margin, user provided notes, findings degree severity. Plot can customized input button like sliders, drag drop checkbox. App also generate multiple summary table studies. Summary table also highly customizable can downloaded different format.

title: Introduction
text: landing page (Program tab) button bottom left sidebar called “Need Help?”. user click button show use app provide self guided tour button page.

title: Introduction
text: button top left column called “Need Help?”. user click button provide self guided tour button page.

title: Introduction
text: button top left column called “Show Help Button”. user click button, show two button 1. Need Help? start 2. Manual Entry button provide self guided tour page give information input button enter data .

title: Introduction
text: User can enter nonclinical data manually nonclinical data can filled database. extract database, user need create SQLite database Standard Exchange Nonclinical Data (SEND). Instruction create SEND database can found https://github.com/phuse-org/sendigR. user choose connect database, user need one csv file map studies corresponding program number. example file can found link. example, study ID GLP003, PDS2014 CV01 id column, belong program number 155582 (last 3 rows). Make sure first column contain program number second column contain study ID number.

title: Introduction
text: user create program add study information, app create plot plot shown program tab. Plot can think two subplot. left plot, one big rectangular represents one study small rectangular box represents dose. color small rectangular box green, represent Observed Adverse Effect Level (NOAEL) dose. doses colored black. Mouse hovering dose box show exposure margin. User can select show dose exposure margin time checkbox. right plot, dose box color coded degree severity finding. Mouse hovering box show finding. whole plot can customized changing different input located top plot.

title: Introduction
text: App generate multiple summary table located right side figure tab. Clinical relevance table group findings. User can look finding common across studies. Table also show reversibility, dose exposure margin information. key finding table show findings found greater NOAEL dose study. Table also include NOAEL, Cmax, AUC safety margin column. safety margin table show studies NOAEL dose. filter study NOAEL dose. Table include NOAEL, HED (Human Equivalent Dose) Cmax, AUC, safety margin proposed clinical dose. notes table show notes user provided note adding study nonclinical section. table can downloaded csv, Excel microsoft word file. User also can download plot image (jpeg file).

what: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results
title: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results
text: toxSummary R Shiny app visualize summarize repeat-dose toxicology study results. toxSummary app wrapped R package (also called toxSummary) app can distributed easily.

title: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results
text: Prior initiation clinical trials, repeat-dose toxicology studies conducted multiple species support safety active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) proposed clinical dosing regimen, route administration, duration treatment. primary metric used extrapolate safety clinical dosage repeat-dose toxicology study results safety margin, .e. ratio observable adverse effect level (NOAEL) toxicology study proposed clinical dose. ratio can calculated using allometric scaling approximate equivalent human dose used toxicology study based body surface area species employed comparing empirically measured maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) total plasma exposure (AUC) toxicokinetic animal data human pharmacokinetic data, available. Another important consideration drug safety evaluation nature severity toxicities observed doses NOAEL. toxicity studies various durations typically conducted multiple species potentially via multiple routes administration, can challenging effectively integrate information. collaboration Pharmaceutical Users Software Exchange (PHUSE) Nonclinical Scripts Working Group consultation toxicologists FDA, open source R shiny application developed allow users interactively visualize safety margins severity user-defined significant toxicities across studies throughout drug development program single plot. application can also present information tabular form can exported various formats, e.g. CSV, Excel Word files. functionalities designed facilitate holistic evaluation drug safety generating graphical tabular summaries full toxicological profile API.

title: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results
text: Package can installed CRAN. Development version can installed GitHub.
code: #install toxSummary package install.packages("toxSummary") # install devtools if already not installed  install.packages("devtools")  #install toxSummary package devtools::install_github('phuse-org/toxSummary')

title: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results

what: Run the app with database connection
title: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results
text: save_file_path set NULL, files saved current working directory. example database can found GitHub repository database link database_path = "path///database.db"studyid_file = "path//program_studyid_mapping.csv" Package contain database. Database big package.
code: library(toxSummary) toxSummary::toxSummary_app(     database_path = "path/of/your/database.db",     studyid_file = "path/for/program_studyid_mapping.csv",     save_file_path = NULL )

what: How to run the app from cloned repo.
title: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results
text: Clone GitHub repo set repo working directory. don’t database connect want run app, run following code R console. run app database connection follow direction; set repo working directory open app.R file (copy code given ) run code. connect database change path files. otherwise connect example database available test_data directory. open toxSummary app. default/example database (“test_data/test_db.db” directory) contain studies.
code: pkgload::load_all(".") toxSummary::toxSummary_app() pkgload::load_all(".") db_path <- "test_data/test_db.db" study_list_path <- "test_data/IND_with_studies_2.csv" toxSummary::toxSummary_app(     database_path = db_path,     studyid_file = study_list_path,     save_file_path = NULL )

title: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results
text: First create app.R file working directory. copy code change database file paths. Deploying Shiny app package little different. publish button open app.R file RStudio. Running rsconnect::writeManifest() command R console create manifest.json file. app can deployed rsconnect runningrsconnect::deployApp() command R console. Keep mind app running server, app need access files given database_path studyid_file argument.
code: toxSummary::toxSummary_app(     database_path = "path/of/your/database.db",     studyid_file = "path/for/program_studyid_mapping.csv",     save_file_path = NULL,     where_to_run = "rsconnect")

title: Visualize and Summarize Repeat-Dose Toxicology Study Results
text: demo app can found demo app link

title: Run toxSummary app — toxSummary_app
text: Run toxSummary app

title: Run toxSummary app — toxSummary_app
code: toxSummary_app(   database_path = NULL,   studyid_file = NULL,   save_file_path = NULL,   where_to_run = "local" )

title: Run toxSummary app — toxSummary_app
text: database_path Optional, character file path database studyid_file Optional, character file path studyid save_file_path Optional, character path file saved app create files. NULL, file saved current working directory where_to_run Optional, character app running. Default "local". use "rsconnect" deploy rsconnect.

title: Run toxSummary app — toxSummary_app
text: function run app.
